title: ARM64: Beacon chain panics during sync after upgrading to v1.3.2
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description When I run the beacon chain, I receive a segmentation fault error at the moment of the finish of the sync in the beacon chain ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Yes, the previous version I was running was: 1.2.1 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I execute the beacon chain with the following command: ``` #!/bin/bash GRAFFITI=BLAHBLAH /opt/validator/prysm.sh validator --wallet-dir=/opt/validator/wallet --wallet-password-file=/opt/validator/pwdfile.txt --mainnet --web --monitoring-host=0.0.0.0 --accept-terms-of-use --graffiti=${GRAFFITI} ``` ## üî• Error The trace is too long, so I prefer share this gist https://gist.github.com/eidast/890ca15a145d195883fe7d5398227e0a ## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:**

**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  

1.3.2
**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?** I rollback to 1.2.1 and everything back to work, after that I upgrade to 1.2.2 and worked as expected. AWS Instance: - t4g.xlarge

Running it with an interop genesis state also fails at snappy. This seems like a snappy specific issue over here on arm64, the short term solution to this would be to revert go 1.16 for now:
https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/pull/8521

I am using the latest v1.3.2 on ARM64 of an AWS c6g.large instance.
